advantages: In-place and non-comparison based sorting algorithm, requiring only O(n) additional space.
Optimal for minimizing the number of writes: it performs the minimum number of writes to sort the array.
Stable sorting algorithm: maintains the relative order of equal elements.
Works well for small datasets and scenarios where minimizing writes is crucial, such as in EEPROM memory.
disadvantages: Complex to implement compared to simpler sorting algorithms like Insertion Sort or Bubble Sort.
Inefficient for larger datasets with a time complexity of O(n^2) in average and worst cases.
May have a higher constant factor in its time complexity, making it slower in practice for larger inputs.
